metadata.Title: CVE-2019-19051 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - low.
metadata.Description:
A memory leak in the i2400m_op_rfkill_sw_toggle() function in drivers/net/wimax/i2400m/op-rfkill.c in the Linux kernel before 5.3.11 allows attackers to cause a denial of service (memory consumption), aka CID-6f3ef5c25cc7. It was discovered that the Intel WiMAX 2400 driver in the Linux kernel did not properly deallocate memory in certain situations. A local attacker could use this to cause a denial of service (kernel memory exhaustion).

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-19051` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-1062-aws - 4.4.0-1062.66
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1074-azure - 4.15.0-1074.79~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-174-generic - 4.4.0-174.204~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-174-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-174.204~14.04.1

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'was needs-triage ESM criteria').
linux-aws package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1062.66').
linux-azure package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1074.79~14.04.1').
linux-lts-xenial package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-174.204~14.04.1').
linux-signed: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'was needs-triage ESM criteria').
linux-signed-azure package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1074.79~14.04.1').
linux-signed-lts-xenial package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-174.204~14.04.1').
